main event: Two bright metallic oval objects were observed in Glendale, California on June 17, 1949.
interesting points: The objects were first noticed due to sunlight reflecting off their surface,The observation lasted approximately 1 and a half minutes,The objects approached from the northeast and disappeared to the northwest,The observed altitude was about 4,000 feet,The witness described the objects as being chrome plated without any visible protrusions.
witness description: The witness was a civilian, described as intelligent and stable, about thirty years of age.
